intro: Amphicome emodi, commonly known as the mountain buttercup, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with five petals, often accompanied by numerous sepals. It thrives in cool, moist environments at high altitudes. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and sensitive indicator of alpine ecosystems.
